main event: A bright bluish-green object was observed in the Green River Lakes area of Wyoming on October 5, 1953. The object had an erratic motion with varying degrees of brightness and stayed in the same general vicinity for 15-17 minutes.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a bright bluish-green color and was a very bright object in the sky.
The object had a very erratic motion, moving in different directions and with varying degrees of brightness.
The object remained in the same general area for 15-17 minutes before gradually fading and disappearing.
The observers compared the object to the appearance of Sputnik, but noted differences in color, brightness, and erratic motion.
The weather conditions were clear with the stars easily visible, and there were no reports of any other astronomical phenomena that could explain the sighting.
sighted object: a bright bluish-green unidentified aerial object
